Baked turkey meatballs are a neat and tidy way to make very lean meatballs, too! I use lean turkey breast, and add grated carrots and an egg to bind them and add moisture so they don’t dry out. Bake for 15 minutes while you get everything else ready for dinner, and literally you have dinner in under 30 minutes.

Report Abuse. ***I have always baked my 1 1/2 inch meatballs at 350 degrees for approximately 25 minutes, I sacrifice the middle ones to make sure it's not pink in the middle, I make 90 at a time and freeze them in batches of 6. This way they're ready for meatball sandwiches on homemade pizza, and in Lasagna.
